CompairTo4.summary: Compares the current Mutable Tuple objct to the given Mutable Tuple object with the same number of elements.
CompairTo4.param: An MTuple with the same number of elements to compare with the current instance.
CompairTo4.returns:
A signed integer that indicates the relative position of this instance and other in the sort order, as shown in the following table.
Value Description
Less than zero This instance precedes obj in the sort order.
Zero This instance occurs in the same position in the sort order as obj.
Greater than zero This instance follows obj in the sort order.

CompleteDoc3.summary: Compares the current Mutable Tuple objct to the given object.
CompleteDoc3.param: An object to compare with the current instance.
CompleteDoc3.returns:
A signed integer that indicates the relative position of this instance and other in the sort order, as shown in the following table.
Value Description
Less than zero This instance precedes obj in the sort order.
Zero This instance occurs in the same position in the sort order as obj.
Greater than zero This instance follows obj in the sort order.

CompleteDoc.summary: Compares the current Mutable Tuple object to a specified object by using a specified comparer, and returns an integer that indicates whether the current object is before, after, or in the same position as the specified object in the sort order.
CompleteDoc.param: An object to compare with the current instance.
An object to compare with the current instance.
An object that provides custom rules for comparison.
CompleteDoc.returns:
A signed integer that indicates the relative position of this instance and other in the sort order, as shown in the following table.
Value Description
Less than zero This instance precedes obj in the sort order.
Zero This instance occurs in the same position in the sort order as obj.
Greater than zero This instance follows obj in the sort order.

An object that provides custom rules for comparison.

A signed integer that indicates the relative position of this instance and other in the sort order, as shown in the following table.
